div.sent: In Bangladesh many poultry-birds die for want of proper treatment every year.
As a result, tremendous loss occurs in meeting the demand for meat and eggs, even in the economy of the country.
In case of poultry if treatment is done after they attacked with diseases very insignificant result can be achieved.
In case of poultry birds, prevention is better than treatment.
This is a very fatal infectious disease.
In rural areas it is also called Chuna disease.
This disease spreads very rapidly.
In our country outbreak of this disease takes place during winter and spring seasons.
Symptoms of the disease are revealed one week after the germs of the disease enters into the body.
The diseased fowl leaves the flock and sits alone in one corner of the house.
The layer gives up laying eggs.
The diseased fowl stops eating.
The head turns downward and begins to drowse.
The diseased fowl passes stool like white lime.
The diseased fowl blows its nose and salivates from its mouth.
Respiration becomes rapid and breaths by opening the mouth.
Some times makes Kok kok sound during breathing in.
The wings swing downwards.
The neck of the fowl becomes curved.
Sometimes it rotates like a wheel standing on the same place.
The fowl becomes weak and sits keeping its beak and chest on the earth.
Liquid stool is seen on the rear feathers.
The fowl dies within 1 -2 days after the disease is revealed.
The main way of protecting the fowls from this disease is to use preventive vaccine.
This vaccine has been distributing throughout whole Bangladesh by livestock offices.
BCRDV for Small Chicks : One-day old chicks are to be vaccinated System of Use :
The original vaccine of the phial should be mixed with 3 cc distilled water and one drop should be applied to every eye with the help of a dropper.
RDV for Adult Fowls : This vaccine is to be applied when the fowls are of more than 2 months of age.
System of Use : The original vaccine of the phial should be mixed with 100 ml of distilled water and I ml should be injected into the muscle of the thigh of fowl.
There is no proper treatment of this disease.
The diseased fowl should be kept in isolation and should not be sold anywhere.
The dead fowls should not be thrown hither and thither; it should be rather buried into soil.
Potash-mixed water can be fed to both diseased and healthy fowls.
Sulphadiazine tablet should be divided into four parts and the adult fowlshould be fed with one part twice daily.
Fowl pox is a viral fatal contagious disease.
This disease can affect fowls of all ages.
But this disease is deadly for the young fowls.
Generally fowl pox disease can be found mostly between October to March.
In the featherless areas of the fowl such as car, comb of the head, surroundings of the eyes etc. small or big blisters appear and sores develop later on.
Afterwards black covers develop on it.
The bruises remain under this cover.
Bruises develop on the lids of the eyes and the lids are swelled up.
As a result the eyes are closed partially or wholly.
Bruises develop in the mouth.
Fowls cannot eat.
Production capacity is decreased and laying of egg is stopped.
Some times the adult fowls can survive but the young ones die.
The fowls are to be vaccinated timely.
System of Pushing Vaccine: The vaccine shall have to be prepared by mixing the original vaccine from the phial with distilled water.
A two-mouthed needle should be dipped into the prepared vaccine again and again and pushed into the inner featherless area of the wing.
Generally, vaccination should be done once in a year.
This disease is caused by one type of bacteria.
This disease can affect ducks and fowls of all ages in any time of the year.
Generally this disease is found in case of the chicks when they attain more than 4 months of age.
Sometimes some dead fowls can be seen in the flock without showing any symptoms.
Again sometimes the symptoms of disease can be noticed.
Stool of green or yellow colour is passed.
The feathers become rough.
The bird moves the head hither and thither.
Eating is stopped and respiration becomes rapid.
Comb of the head, knee and other parts of the mouth are swell.
Salivates from nose and mouth and thirstiness is increased.
The healthy fowls should be vaccinated after every 6 months.
The vaccine is available in 100 c.c. bottle.
Each poultry bird should be injected with 1 c.c. of this vaccine into the muscle of the thigh.
If the fowl is vaccinated once at the age of 2 and half month, there is no apprehension of attack this disease for 4-5 months.
The house of the diseased fowl should be kept clean.
One to one and a half gm Cosumix powder shall have to be mixed with 1 litre of water and should be fed 3 times in succession.
Sulphadiazine or Sulphamezathyne or Renamycin tablet should be fed.
This disease is the result of attack of a parasite called Coccidia.
This disease can be found generally in the chicks of less than 2 months of age.
Sometimes 70-80% of the chicks are attacked with this disease and die.
Stops taking food and water.
The fowl begins to drowse.
The feathers become rough and the fowl keeps its eyes closed.
The chicks become weak before death and die within 4-5 hours.
The shell of the egg of laying hen becomes thin and egg laying decreased.
Passes loose excreta mixed with blood.
The poultry house should be a condition having plenty of air, light and temperature.
The used instruments should be kept clean.
The littre should always be dry and clean.
In this case rice husks or saw-dust can be used.
It is a very contagious disease caused by virus.
Generally this type of disease can be mostly found in the chicks of 3-12 weeks age.
Once affected the effectiveness of all vaccines are spoiled and the chicks become susceptible to other disease.
Passes loose stool with obnoxious smell.
The feathers become rough.
Stops eating and thrust for water is increased.
Lies down on the ground due to shivering tiredness and at last the bird dies from dehydration.
30- 40% ducks die within 3 days of attack by the disease.
If vaccination becomes impossible, when the bird attains 14 days of age always saline solution should be fed after every 2 days up to 3 months of age.
100 gm molasses and 15 ml vinegar should be mixed with I litre of water and should be fed in the noon.
Two packets orsaline and 4 vitamin B-12 tablet should be mixed with I litre of water and should be fed at the evening go at night.
Virus causes this disease.
It is a fatal contageous disease.
The expiry rate caused by this disease is high.
This disease can affect ducks of any age.
Unwillingness appears in food taking, becomes thirsty and the ducks can be seen to drink water repeatedly.
The duck starts passing very loose motion and stool adheres in tail areas.
248 Agricultural Education The duck becomes afraid of light, liquid things come through the nose and the mouth.
The legs and wings become paralyzed.
Trembling appears in head, neck and body The affected duck sits depending on its chest.
Laying of eggs by layer-ducks suddenly decrease.
The ducks have to be saved by using duck.
One plague vaccine I ml vaccine has to be injected into the muscle of thigh of each duck.
There is no treatment of diseased duck.
The diseased duck should immediately be separated.
The diseased ducks should be properly buried.
External parasites: Such as lice and mites.
These types of parasites attack both ducks and fowls.
Generally the eggs of worms enter into the body of fowl with food and from wet dirty floor of the house.
The poultry birds are vulnerable to be affected by different types of worms.
Out of those the most important ones are round worms, tape worms, thread worms etc.
The following symptoms are revealed when the poultry birds are attacked by worms.
The comb of the head becomes white or pale.
The symptoms of blood anemia appear in faces.
The bones of the chest become visible.
The bird begins to wither the feathers become rough and growth is retarded.
Passes blood-mixed liquid stool.
Sometimes worms are seen to come out with stool.
The body weight decreases and laying of egg is stopped.
When the number of worm is enormous the intestinal tube is blocked and the bird Prevention of Worms-Disease.
Medicine of worms is to be fed at least after every 3 months.
The house is to be kept clean always and other sanitation measures are to be followed.
Pyralgin Should be fed with food as per prescription of the livestock expert.
If the balanced food is deficient in vitamin different symptoms develop in the body of poultry birds.
As a result the productivity is hampered.
Night-blind disease develops due to want of vitamin-A.
The eye lids are swelled and water comes out of the eyes.
Odorless pass-like things comes out from nose and mouth The feathers become rough.
Body growth is hampered.
Feeding green vegetables such as leaves of cabbage, kalmi shak, spinach, green grass and cod liver with balanced diet help to prevent to a great extent.
There should be arrangement for sufficient sunlight in the house of poultry birds, the birds should be fed green vegetables and cod-liver oil.
Grass and dusts of dried fish should be fed with food.
The activity of vaccines is lost if those are not preserved properly.
Preservation of vaccines is very important.
Specifications should be known from the manufacturing company of the vaccines and the vaccine is to be preserved accordingly.
Some vaccines are to be preserved in freezing, condition and some to be preserved in day places.
The vaccines are to transported by putting ice in flask.
Reasons for Degradation of the Activities of Vaccines.
If the proper use of vaccine is not known.
If the vaccine is not used within specified time.
If the vaccine is used after expiry date.
When the vaccine is, used in proper place and proper method.
If two separate vaccines are used at the same time.
If the vaccine is not used for definite disease.
If the bird is infected by the particular disease before the vaccine is used.
